- 'Ghost in the Shell'
- 'Fairy Tail'
- 'Hajime no Ippo: The Fighting Spirits'
- 'Tokyo Revengers'
- 'Initial D'


Discover K MANGA Original Series Simulpubbed with Japan:
- 'Don‚Äôt Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro'
- 'The Fragrant Flower Blooms with Dignity'
- 'WIND BREAKER'
- 'As a Reincarnated Aristocrat, I‚Äôll Use My Appraisal Skill to Rise in the World'
- 'Alya Sometimes Hides Her Feelings in Russian'


Explore a diverse array of genres including Action, Romance, Sports, Isekai, Suspense, Outlaws, Drama, Fantasy, Slice of Life, Shojo, and more.


If you're a fan of K MANGA or curious about our latest titles, follow us on X: [https://twitter.com/KMANGA_KODANSHA] - Stay updated on our releases and exciting news!
summary: Kodansha official Manga app

scraped_reviews.content: Honestly? It's just ok. I think that Manga Plus has a more user friendly approach by letting you get up to date on running series for free and only requiring a subscription to re-read *and* making the three most recent chapters free. Here it's a pay by chapter/use free chapter tickets system which stalls your progress if you get *really* into a series. I understand why it's set up like this but it's still really disappointing if you're playing catch up or just trying to be up to date.

It's not bad, but it's not great. The pricing alone is absolutely absurd. It's nice to be able to read stuff that isn't out/printed in the US yet. But having to pay $75 to get enough points to catch up on a recent manga I'm reading is a hard pass. If I'm paying that kind of money, I want the physical copy in my hands. I'll wait or find other means. I'd pay a subscription to read, even with cap chapters, like the SJ app. But I am not paying per chapter.

Easy to use, large selection. They tend to split chapters which is especially annoying when you're effectively paying per chapter. They do offer quite a few free credits for chapters and you can watch an ad for credits or for access to a chapter but their primary method for access is for you to buy points that you can spend on access to chapters. The reader itself is easy to use. If they got a monthly subscription for all access it would be perfect.

The price points are way too high, especially for an app that's heavily bloated with ads. It's only slightly cheaper than buying the physical volumes. The manga quality is great, so it's a fantastic way to try out a series while supporting the official release. That is, until you hit the massive pay wall and just go back to pirating. If they let you catch up to current with the ad based ticket system, or added a subscription fee, it would be great, but they don't, and most likely wont.

Way too expensive. Uninstalling and very disappointed. Update: 3/14/24 I decided to give it another try. It's exactly the same. I wish I could give another 1 star rating or even 0 stars. Barely any chapters are free. Paid chapters start about less than halfway through a series and are extremely expensive and split into parts. I'll stick with digital or physical volumes.

When pre registering, it was advertised that it would be completely free but instead it seems that everything is run by micro transactions. You have to get tickets or coins. When using tickets you don't even get to keep what you redeemed, it gives you a time limit. There are a lot of free chapters but even given that it launched a week ago they are already expiring. Take it back to the drawing board. Would not recommend.

At first glance - pretty solid. Polished UX and unobtrusive ads. But once you see the paywall it's way too greedy. The first 5 or so chapters are free, then they are heavily timed, and the second half of the series can typically only be bought with money. The point system is transparent: 1 point is 1 penny, but that doesnt change the fact that you can easily be required to spend over 100$ to acquire a single series and that's not helping our trade deficit :3. So yeah,good luck with that,Kodansha

I'll give an A for effort and having good selection. But an F for affordability. The price point is set way too high. For example; you would have to spend $75 to unlock 130 chapters of a manga. The problem is, you'll never own those chapters. So what incentive is there to blow your money on something you'll never own? The day this app goes under, you'll lose access to everything. You're better off using the free chapters and saving up to buy physical copies of the manga.

The UI is nice at least... But why did they have to go with the points model? Shueisha's subscription model is infinitely better, and I can't afford to pay for all the latest chapters in this model (no, unlike Manga Plus, the newest chapters are generally not free from what I can see). Kodansha had the chance to become a real competitor in the online space, but this is... Not the way to do it.

When analyzing this app on Exodus, it contains 21 different trackers, which is a ton. For comparison, Facebook has 9 trackers. No manga app needs this much data from its users. Add to that, this app is really egregious in monetization. There isn't a real subscription option, only getting a set amount of points each month to purchase manga chapters. Meanwhile, on Shounen Jump you can pay $5 every month and read as much as you want. Terrible value and a complete invasion of privacy.

Yea this is one of the most disappointing releases in quite some time. Let me start out with what might be the only positive: a good UI and competent scrolling/search. Now for the bad... In all the market research that was done, who thought it was a good idea to copy the flop that is MangaUp? Instead of a subscription based service, we have to pay double sometimes triple for full releases. In an industry where your main competitors (SJ/Viz) are killing it with the subscription model.

Exploitative monetization model, splitting up chapters into multiple parts so you have to pay MORE, and a confusing ticket system all paired with a bad app design (search doesn't seem to work half the time, no dark mode, among other weird choices) makes me not recommend this at all. I could overlook most of it if they got rid of the bad monetization choices and bring in a subscription model, but as it is right now, don't waste your money, and buy the actual physical or digital volumes.

The primary issue is the monetization system, it's far too expensive for digital media. With the Viz model it's much more palatable, I would be more inclined to pay for a subscription then this pay as you go coin system, it's like webtoons which is why I stopped reading. The UI and search also needs improvement. You have the key elements there, it wouldn't take much to be able to search by say completed series, frequency of updates, and more. Pinch to zoom also does not function on the pixel6

The UI is good, though somewhat confusing. The point system is awful though, pricing isn't consistent and they lie about titles being completely free (only a free chapters are, then you get three videos to "unlock" chapters and that's it). I don't mind paying a subscription, but I won't do a point buy system. Sucks and makes me sad, I've been waiting a long time to read some favorites.

I don't like the point system, highly disappointed. I was this app was going to be similar to the shonen jump app, but unfortunately it's not. While they're are free chapters provided, which is great for new readers, but for readers who are caught up on a series, you have to jump through hoops just read the latest chapter. I wish there was a decent subscription option similar to what other legitimate manga apps have.

My biggest issue is the black box censorship, they aren't your typical tiny black boxes but boxes that take up the whole page at times. Not only are you missing out on the art it just makes you uninterested, at least it does for me. They should honestly just have some series marked as 18+ or something at this point. Overall the app is fine, has some great stories. Just your typical manga app, maybe a little less good compared to other apps such as manga up, manga+ and viz/shonen Jump.

Using this app let me read some of my favorite series. However, once you read the first 5-10 chapters for free, you are then presented with an option to use an "unlock key" to view a single, additional chapter. After that, you are encouraged to buy "points" to unlock more chapters to read. It is at this point where this app appears to be a cash grab. My advice would be to search for a different low cost subscription based app. Wait for this one to improve. If it doesn't, I recommend deleting it.

The app begs for quality of life improvements. For new releases, they charge around the same money per-chapter as what it costs to buy a physical volume, while saving the costs for producing and distributing physical books. Chapters are cheap, but it adds up, and with the app you don't get physical copies to own and share, while they earn much, much more money off your reading. Throw us a bone, Kodansha. Charge less money, and add at least basic settings for customizing the UI and reader.

The best thing I can say about the app is reading feels good on it, but other than that, it won't bookmark the page you left off, there's censorship in some of the series and the worst is how monetized it is. It absolutely feels like a cash grab. I wanted it to work, but it seems I will be keeping to other manga apps for now. At least I can say I gave it a fair try.

Per chapter based model that is ridiculously expensive. Up to $1 or more per chapter on some titles which is just insane. It should be a subscription based model and heck they could even charge $5-$10 a month and I'd say it's worth it with the selection of titles but with the prices now you're better off just buying the physical manga.

Who came up with this system? People can watch ads for "up to" 50p (more like 5p), but need 69p to read most chapters. Otherwise, they can install other apps, or just pay for points. Not installing other apps. And you want $1 for about every 103p. That's around $67 to read 100 chapters. People can pay $3 and read almost all of Shonen Jumps' catalog. Literally thousands of chapters. I was willing to pay a similar fee, as I've paid Jump for 3 years now. But this pricing system is absurd.

Literally the worst possible route they could have gone. I'm fine with paying for content, but paying these prices to RENT chapters is ridiculous. This should have been a subscription service. Since the library has so much in it, a more premium price would have been fine. Point and ticket systems to rent is just a scam. You need to relaunch this. The way chapters are split into multiple transactions is also extra scummy.

It looks like a bad mobile cash grab game that you'd see in every ad. It's a shame to see all these fantastic manga effectively unavailable to read. Just get the new viz media app alongside shonen jump, they let you read the last 3 and first 3 chapters for free as well as being cheap if you did want to read more at 1.99 and 2.99 respectively. Don't waste your time on this

this app is really awful its very confusing, has only a very small collection of manga(even if they are some popular ones) and it's impossible to read because it only gives you one free chapter a day. A chapter takes barely 5 minutes to read, and it only stays free for 48 hours. it's also just not user friendly at all. it's so clunky and annoying to navigate

Region restricted in Canada. The points system is obnoxious and invasive. This makes for a terrible, gamified reading experience. Rather than having a free, daily limit with ads, then a premium subscription for full access, we get something akin to the worst kinds of freemium games. I got this to keep up with the latest chapters of Witch Hat Atelier, but I am disappointed in Kodansha for this horrible app.

There is no reason this app needs to be so complicated and ad heavy. Instead of relying on this "points" and "tickets" nonsense, offer us a low cost subscription to avoid all that and make everything readable. I'm not watching hours of ads or signing up for sketchy offers just to earn points to read some chapters. Nor am I going to spend a ridiculous amount to buy some points. It's not worth it. Shonen Jump, Viz Manga, and Azuki have subscriptions, why can't Kodansha?

You've gotta be kidding me with this pricing model. This app exists solely to nickel and dime you. The ticket system is super stingy, and that's if the series even allows you to use them, chapters have different point costs, and of course, coincidentally the popular series cost more points are restrictive on ticket use. All you had to do Kodansha, was allow us to read the latest chapters and the starting chapters for free and lock the rest behind a subscription like Viz, not this total rip off.

The second best manga/comic app. Period. There's no way you can beat Webtoon. But for a media company in the way Kodansha is, it's commendable to be second. Great library. Granted clunky UI. Would like a search bar. They don't split up chapters unless the authors themselves split them up into multiple parts. They tell you the average release times. Reasonable reading system. Yeah you'll have to buy coins sometimes but constant specials too. Would love a subscription with full access though. $6?

It's do defeating the method they went with instead of a normal monthly subscription, I'm sure they'd make more in the long term even if they charged $8-$12 per month, I'd gladly pay that. But no, they had to go and make it like a video game with microtransactions, needing to buy coins or watch ads or whatnot. They truly are out of touch by going with this decision.

Wish it was more of a subscription model instead of a points based one. It makes me not want to explore and find new manga that I might like. The points model is very archaic, and most companies have abandoned it. The censorship in certain manga also does not help. I'll give it a little more time before I see about deleting it. Was looking forward to reading the official Nagatoro chapters, but think I'll wait for the volumes.

To put it bluntly, this is a really bad My only pro the scans are high quality and controls are intuitive Cons -The buy in system of points and tickets is not well laid out and egregious -Tickets will get you 3 chapters a day for free, but with an ad on the 3rd, while points are expensive/won't get you much. $1 gets you 2 chapters -there is no alphabetical list of what you can look at, it's all promotion based or the "serialization" tab shows what day each series posts on even if it's complete

In the Japanese version, chapters for a series I follow need 50 coins to unlock past old chapters and 70 to unlock more recent chapters. In the English version, you need 69 and 99 coins respectively (using that manipulative practice of subtracting 1 coin to make it seem cheaper, I see). In JP, 650 coins is $4.83. In ENG, 515 coins is $5. Stay away from this scam. They don't even have all the manga from the JP version.

pretty nice app. I like how well organized it is and the selection of manga. o also the search option and how you can use keywords of what your looking for in the specific genre or title of manga you want. however, I don't like that it doesn't save my progress in chapters that I've started. there's no bookmark function what I can see. when I tap the chapter that I last stopped on, it just starts the chapter over. I hope you implement a bookmarking feature.

Disappointed that it's not a subscription based system. The other reason is that you need to buy points to pay for manga. It's a personal preference but I think they should just tell me how a dollar price instead of having to figure out points. Also why are the points such high numbers 1 to 10 is fine. There is no good reason to have it 69 other to say "nice". They are also running a "free" promotion for some title but instead of everything being free like its advertised they only make some free

One of the worst manga apps I've seen in a long time. Gacha mechanics to get tickets to read only SOME chapters. Paid currency to read 1 chapter at a time (outrageous pricing, might as well just buy paper manga), over the top censorship even though they ask for age verification, and a frequently nonfunctional reading experience. The fact that people think this is a 4 star average experience only goes to show how bad digital manga platforms are. I just rather not read their series anymore.

Daily free ticket system, but the freedom of tickets stops insanely quickly. For instance; The 'Curse Crafter' series literally in every other YouTube ad ONLY lets you use tickets for the first 20 chapters, before forcing you to pay money to read beyond that. Otherwise, decent-ish manga introduction app. Use this to find stories/works that you could be interested in, then check elsewhere for freely uploaded chapters.

honestly, they use a pretty ingenious (albeit slightly annoying) monetization strategy here, and the app's layout and functionality is absolutely amazing. There is, however, one unfathomably massive problem: the coding for the video ads you can watch to read a chapter for free is so atrocious that it completely breaks the in-app experience, rarely working as intended, if it works at all and doesn't just trap you in a doom spiral of getting your app stuck on an ad that refuses to progress.

I like reading the Blue Lock manga, so I decided to get this app. I found it cool that there were many different types of animes involved. I found out my favourite romance by reading one. I also started to watch an anime I watched in the past. Overall, I think this app is amazing, but I don't like how I have to pay to read some of the manga

the app is good it's url is good . it offers a lot of popular anime title manga at free of cost by daily ticket which you get you can basically rent the chapter for 24 hours and then if you need to read it again you can use the ticket or you can buy the manga too so it will be filled in your library and its a good app I love it . I can read some of the coolest manga which I want to read at free . must recommend

the pricing for most manga is absolutely crazy. I'm not gonna pay 100$ for a full story which are just pixels on my screen. in that case if I wanna read legally I would just go to MangaPLUS for $4/month. K manga is one of the reasons privacy prevails. also, piracy manga websites are higher quality.
I would really appreciate it if they ever add a monthly subscription option. By that time I will raise my review to 5 stars. Overall the app is good, I actually like the quality of the manga pages.

The site will lose ALL your purchases from the app when you log out. This even includes when the site automatically logs you out. It is $0.5-1 per chapter of manga. Better to buy the manga from other sites.
Acceptance of terms and privacy process initially blocked, but solved by using a different ISP. Gives a generous free reading allowance per day of some great titles. Not ad free.
The ticket system is awful, and should just be a subscription. but it's really nice to have simulpubs in English. I just read on other sites and then come back when I've caught up.
Not a fan of the point system. Subscription based would be better. Otherwise, nice selection of manga and manhwa. Hopefully their would be more selections to come in the future.
The app won't even load anymore for me. It stuck at white screen after the opening logo. Restarting the app, clearing the cache, turning off-on internet didn't work. Wasted tickets because of it üòë

I was going to subscribe but your little "points" system is so despicable I don't even know how to end this sentence to adequately describe how disappointed, annoyed, and hopeless toward the future of our species.

God-awful. The chapters of each series are split up into 2-3 parts, so you have to pay extra for EVERY SINGLE THING on this app. anything free in the app is very limited; you get a small handful of free tickets that usually expire before you can even use them, and seemingly the 100 newest chapters for every series are PAID ONLY. the Mangaplus app is so much better in every single aspect. it is a crime that this app is the only way to read some magnificent series.
Censored content, convoluted payment schemes that border on a gacha game. Only purchased chapters can be downloaded for offline, free chapters don't have a download option.

terrible experience to try and binge read a series it's a joke considering if I want to read the entirety of a series depending on the length it can cost over 150$ while this still might be a cheaper way having to buy all the volumes but these are for the digital version I would rather spend 5 dollars a month and have a limit to a 100 chapters a day then having to spend over a dollar a chapter and having to do so for every series is gonna weaken the overall experience and drive me away

title: Gopuff‚ÄîFood & Drink Delivery
description:
Thousands of items ‚Äì delivered faster than you‚Äôd ever expect. Gopuff is less of a delivery app and more of a teleportation device, bringing you everything you need in as fast as 15 minutes. From groceries and frozen food to home care products and more, Gopuff has you covered. Planning a party? Simply tap it, and we‚Äôll bring it with a wide selection of snacks, drinks, and even alcohol. Yes, you can also find the Solo cups and ping pong balls.


From early ‚Äòtil late, we‚Äôll take care of your meal delivery and everything in between. With several locations operating 24/7, you can order and get back to streaming, no matter the time of day. Simply open up the app, tap on what you want, and experience the magic. Why so fast? We skip the middleman. It all comes directly from one of our micro-fulfillment centers, saving you both time and money. We don‚Äôt charge surge pricing because we don‚Äôt stop at a store, it‚Äôs all from us. 


Find all of your favorite brands at their lowest prices ‚Äì whether big-names or local on Gopuff. From Ben & Jerry‚Äôs, Simply, Gatorade, Coca-Cola, Cheetos, Slim Jim, Arizona, Reese‚Äôs, Doritos, Lays, Smuckers, Organic Valley, Titos, White Claw, and many more. We could name them all day, but it‚Äôs easier if you hop in and look for yourself.


The best part? New customers get 50% off their first two orders with code: WELCOME. Max discount $20 per order. Join the FAM, and download Gopuff today!

YOUR FAVORITE ITEMS
- Thousands of snacks, drinks, everyday essentials and more at your fingertips
- Get items for your next party delivered in no time ‚Äì Cheese and charcuterie, paper towels, cleaning supplies, we have what you need
- With over 500 micro-fulfillment centers, we‚Äôre able to deliver your favorite products in over 1000+ cities**
- Seamlessly check out with your preferred payment method ‚Äì credit card, debit card, Apple Pay, or Venmo


JOIN THE FAM FOR NO FEES & FREE DELIVERY
- Gopuff FAM members get even ‚Äúlower than low‚Äù prices on everyday essentials like eggs, milk, paper towels, and more. FAM members save an average of $25 per month ($300/year)
- Discover insane weekly deals of up to 60% off dropping every Monday, exclusively for members
- Gopuff FAM members pay $0 delivery fees on every order, any time of day


JOIN STUDENT FAM
- Are you a student? College and university students get full access to Gopuff FAM membership benefits at a 50% discount. Student FAM can often pay for itself in as little as one order.


SHOP YOUR FAVORITE BRANDS
- Lay‚Äôs, Reese‚Äôs, Tito‚Äôs and more. Find local and well-known names all across Gopuff to order what you want
- Starbucks is now available 24/7 for select Philadelphia areas. Coffee lovers can now order their favorite lattes and specialty beverages on Gopuff
- BevMo! customers can now get unparalleled liquor and wine selection delivered in as fast as 15 minutes by Gopuff in California, Arizona and Washington 


AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE
- We hope to deliver your order just right, but just in case it‚Äôs not exactly what you expected, you can always give always our team a call
- Get what you need, how you expect it. We got you covered


FIND GOPUFF NEAR YOU
Gopuff has 500+ micro-fulfillment centers, BevMo! and Liquor Barn Stores. We also serve 1,000+ cities. Find us in Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York City, Philadelphia, Chicago, Austin, San Diego, Houston, Seattle, Miami, and many more across the United States!**


Download Gopuff today, join the FAM, and get more than just meal delivery to your doorstep ‚Äì in as fast as 15 minutes. 


* Beer, wine, liquor, and hot, fresh prepared foods available in select markets. Must be 21 to purchase alcohol. Please drink responsibly.

** Gopuff is not available in all markets‚Äìbut you never know. Want us where you are? Find us on social @gopuff or visit gopuff.com for more.

summary: Order from Gopuff and get your essentials delivered in as fast as 15 minutes

scraped_reviews.content: First time user, I took advantage of the $25 off promo (Snaprelief1) and I just say it was a great experience. my only issue with the site is limited items. The prices could be lower but they make you join a membership for better prices. Other than that it was a good experience and I love they delivere til 2am. So 4 Stars! I'd give 5 if they had a better selection and lower prices.

Tracking map needs work. Dark theme may be cool but its purpose is information, not coolness. Dark is too hard for some people to read. Let us choose light theme. And stop playing with zoom level! I always want to see driver & my place & as little else as possible. Stop changing focus or zooming out when something happens. User is the only person who needs or even sees this view. We each know what we want from it & you don't. Let us set the way we want & stop fiddling with it.

Terrible. I'll never use this app again. 3 straight times I ordered two 12-packs of soda and only got one.I did get a refund for the first two, then the third time they told me there was nothing they could do; their system wouldn't allow it. So basically, they said I was out of luck. On top of sitting on hold for a half hour or more to speak with someone at customer service, it's a joke. I would find a different place to order from if I were you. How could you mess up somebody's order every time

I love using Gopuff! It‚Äôs so convenient to have my favorite snacks and food delivered right to my door whenever I‚Äôm craving something. The app is super easy to use, the GPS tracking is accurate, and I can always see exactly where my order is. Delivery is quick, reliable, and the selection is great. Definitely my go-to app when I need something fast!

Really good. This is the first time I've used the service. It was a smooth transaction and got to me incredibly fast( I'm close in proximity to a warehouse so that sure helps. Just bought a handful of things for a test run. I bought stuff from multiple categories. Diary, Fruit and produce, Beverages, Bakery and pretzels. Very impressed with the speed beginning to end. Order placed Order received in 23 minutes.

well I am a snap benefit receiver, and I seen an ad saying that gopuff is giving 25$ of free groceries to snap people due to the shutdown. I downloaded the app, added my card, and shopped to fill my cart with $25 worth of items. Went to check out, and it asked about a tip, I added the tip that I can afford, after all that, it tells me I don't have enough on my card to cover the $24.65 worth of groceries. I just don't have time for this! I am scrambling to figure out how I am going to feed my kid

Two of my most recent experiences resulted in waiting up to 3 hours for my order to even be packed when delivery was estimated at 30 minutes. They automatically apply a 5 dollar credit and customer service cannot do anything other than say I'm sorry. They also do not know how to delete account information even though it is listed on the website. Gopuff used to be so good. Big sad.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry to hear that. Could you send us a DM so we can assist you directly?

scraped_reviews.content: We placed an order and the warehouse canceled the order because it was a new account. When we contacted customer service, all they said was there was nothing they could do, and wait 3-5 business days for a refund. We were spending over $50 and needed several of the items NOW. This is why I'll stick with DoorDash & UberEats. Absolutely APPALLING!! I'd give ZERO stars, if I could.

so I've had gopuff for years. most of the time it was a great experience until recently. so I paid for the FAM membership on a yearly basis. so I had just paid for a whole year, and out of the blue they decide that my location no longer delivers to my house. I thought it was weird because I'm less than a mile away from the store. I contacted customer service and they said they couldn't fix it. so I asked for a refund on my fam membership since they won't deliver to me, and they said no refunds.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
"Thank you for highlighting this issue to us, and we apologize for the inconvenience this has caused. Please feel free to contact us through your Gopuff app or click the direct link below for more assistance.

https://help.gopuff.com/categories/customer-support/65f86c95e2c6870cf99488d7"

scraped_reviews.content: Wait times advertised are not accurate. They advertise deliveries in 15 minutes and then that wait time once you order is muuuuch longer. Feels very scammy that they give the option to pay a fee to give "priority," but then you'll see that they dropped off someone else's order first. Not helpful when I ordered something that was supposed to be here quickly before I left for work and my 15 minute advertised wait time is now 45 minutes. Use any other service or option first if you can, y'all!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
"Thank you for highlighting this issue to us, and we apologize for the inconvenience this has caused. Please feel free to contact us through your Gopuff app or click the direct link below for more assistance.

https://help.gopuff.com/categories/customer-support/65f86c95e2c6870cf99488d7"

scraped_reviews.content: I just finally deleted my gopuff account after having one for at least 6+ years, I had been a long time customer with next to no issues. Prices used to be okay, now they're incredibly high, unless you sign up for FAM. And I remember when they used to have good customer service, but over the years, it's really gone down hill. They'll deliver expired products and then refuse to give your money back (even with photo proof).

Service has gone way downhill the last few months. Orders being canceled without notification. Items removed from orders without notification. They refuse to refund defective and expired items. Their delivery times are more than an hour now, sometimes two or three hours... I have canceled my subscription. Oh well, this will just save me money because they always have been a bit expensive. I guess thank you GoPuff for letting your service go to ****. It will be good for my wallet.

I USE to luv this app. They have a store not but a few miles away from me . For the longest time almost a yr no problems very happy, I ordered a few times a week . Went a few months not ordering , come back nothing is the same . 1st try sold out of just about everything. Second attempt , not delivering in my area . Too much competition, lost a good customer peace out .
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Lori. We apologize for any inconvenience we may have caused and understand how frustrating this must be. Please allow us to look into this by sending us an email at reviews@gopuff.com with the details and a screenshot or link to this review. - AN

scraped_reviews.content: Easy to use. Service was excellent. We were shopping for stuff we couldn't get at Walmart Grocery and other stores but was skeptical at first. It was pretty late at night when we placed the order. When the order was accepted it stated it would be delivered at 130am. I thought maybe it was an automated alert/mistake made by a new company but I noticed their tracker showed the ordeoving thru their process. It was delivered on time and only 2 items weren't available. Freaking awesome!

Mostly they are reliable and efficient, especially late nights(til 4am) but just like any other service they have their times too where they do urky things like, let you place your order, just to turn around and cancel it due to no driver's wanting to deliver because they are almost closed. Also,if they don't have an item, instead of informing you and giving you an option to choose another while order is still at store, they just won't include item and send order out as is with no communication.

I've been using Gopuff for years now, and it's really been declining as of late. It's definitely the best delivery app out there, but the cons are starting to out weigh the pros. Also, the way they treat out of stock items is atrocious. You'll find out after you've ordered that something was out of stock by them just removing it from your order. No heads up, no replacement options, nothing. It's frustrating and doesn't make the app worth it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Liz. We're incredibly sorry to hear that your experience with us has declined, and we want to make this right. Could you please send us an email at reviews@gopuff.com with more details along with a link or screenshot to this review so we can look into these issues further? - AN

scraped_reviews.content: I'm giving one star because for as long as I've been ordering, even before pandemic lockdowns, 4/5 times I order, I end up getting a call telling me "hey we are out of item x from your order". I don't care that you're out of, I care because nothing is ever up to date on what you have, and it's not that hard to keep accurate inventory. This level of of inaccuracy for your user interface is unacceptable.

The app is mostly easy to use and the ordering process has worked well for me. My main complaint is that twice in the last 12 months it decides I don't have the Fam subscription even though I paid for it. So then I get charged $7 in extra fees and it's 20+ minutes on the phone to see about a refund and they tell me that Fam doesn't include X, Y, or Z until I send them a screenshot from the app showing literally that it includes those things. Such disappointing customer service.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there, Jeff. We sincerely apologize for the FAM subscription troubles. Please let us look into your situation by emailing us at reviews@gopuff.com with a screenshot or link to this review and we will be right there to look into this. - JB

scraped_reviews.content: The app is easy to use and it's useful for many things, you can buy a few grocery items when you need them, buy dinner for the night, etc. They're limited on what they have available as far as produce and vegetables go, however the app basically functions as a visit to the convenience store, so it's understandable. They have very late delivery as well, it's a great app to use.

They need to do a Pin location for the address. Their drives spend to much time looking for exact apartment buildings/numbers. Don't know why they are late to this, all other major food delivery apps have that feature. Helps both the driver and the customer. Edit.. your customer service is horrible. Rather than try and solve my issue they tried to appease me with a $5 discount for a $10 item. Driver lied about my missing item and said another driver was bringing it. They never did.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Joshua. We truly appreciate your feedback and will forward this to our team so we can improve and provide an amazing experience every time you order. If you have any questions or other suggestions you'd like to share, please send us an email at reviews@gopuff.com. We would love to hear from you! - AN

scraped_reviews.content: They make canceling and dealing with support FOR anything, including a refund, an absolute nightmare! They claim no hidden fees for subscribers, but there is. They sneak price hikes in and will says 20min delivery is included with $7.99, but it's not. You'll get 50% off the price of that perk ü§î. This strategy is baked throughout. You'll have a cart of $40, but a total of $56, oh and not including tipping. Use it when you NEED it, it's not too bad for one offs, BUT SUBSCRIBERS BEWARE.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for the experience but we are thankful for your feedback! We will forward this to our team and hopefully we can find ways to improve based on your review. If you have any other suggestions or feedback please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to us at reviews@gopuff.com.

scraped_reviews.content: This was the worst experience I had with a delivery service. I ordered, thinking they would leave the order at my hotel front desk to pick up later. Instead, there was a requirement to scan my ID and texting photos wasn't enough. By the time I tried to reorder, it was sold out and closed everywhere. The ID requirement should be IN THE APP. Now, I literally wasted both time and money.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Kevin. We truly appreciate your feedback, and we apologize for any inconvenience. We will forward this to our team so we can make improvements and better your experience. If you have any questions or have other feedback you'd like to share, please let us know by reaching out to us at reviews@gopuff.com. - AN

scraped_reviews.content: I love this service but this app has SO many glitches. There hasn't been a single time I've tried to use the app that I didn't have to close it and open it again. It has trouble loading pages, frequently freezes when I click an item, and now I've had a new problem, when I went to check out it said something about "sorry we couldn't process your order on this item at the moment" for every item in my cart. This is getting really frustrating.

I really want to enjoy this service but tks so awful. Firstly they never seem to update their inventory, things are on the app but when I order them I never receive the item. I've had, and no joke, ordered 7 items and only 2 showed up and they had the nerve to charge me a small order fee. They never called or texted or message me when things like this happen, I'd rather cancel the order. I have a fam membership by the way. I wish I could say more but I reached the limit. Don't recommend.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Oh no! We're so sorry for any inconvenience this has caused you. Please DM us so we can address your issue and make things right.

scraped_reviews.content: The app doesn't work at all. I've tried to delete and re install many times (over 8) and I can't order anything. When I try to add to bag it keeps me in a continuous loop of going back to the home page. I can't even log into my account nor does it even show what location I'd be ordering from. This has been my experience for over a week. It's sad because I'd really like to use this app more often, the service is fast and there's hardly never any mistakes when it comes to orders.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Oh no! We sincerely apologize for the troubles you've had with the app, Emily. We'd be happy to take a look into this for you. Please contact us at reviews@gopuff.com. Thanks! - CJ

scraped_reviews.content: While I appreciate the concept , the prices are astronomically high. If your order is under 15 dollars, it's considered a small order and you have to add items or pay the small order fee. While I understand, the fees are way to high. For instance I had two bags of chips in my cart and when I went to checkout, it's a 3.45 dollar small order fee on top of the delivery fee which is also 3.45. Not to mention tip and taxes. My total came out to 25 dollars for TWO BAGS of regular sized chips. Insane.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Kali. We truly appreciate your feedback, and we apologize for any inconvenience. We will forward this to our team so we can make improvements and better your experience. If you have any questions or have other feedback you'd like to share, please let us know by reaching out to us at reviews@gopuff.com. - AN

scraped_reviews.content: GoPuff is no longer good. I am a paying monthly subscriber. Nothing is ever delivered in less than 90 min unless you pay extra. (Remember, I already pay monthly!) They'll just keep moving the time window and not admitting it, so you have to screenshot constantly. Customer service used to be real, local people chatting on the other end; now they're outsourced and only respond in scripts. They never give refunds for missing/incorrect items, and everything is 2-3xs more $$ than anywhere else.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: This is certainly not the experience we strive for. Email us at reviews@gopuff.com so we can get this looked into! - NT

scraped_reviews.content: I just canceled my Fam membership after being a GoPuff customer for over 3 years. The service was great for a long time but now it's a mess. They have items showing as available and allow you to make the full purchase however when it gets delivered there is an item missing. Of course they didn't charge for it but how about a product replacement? Also, all of my favorites that I ordered weekly are no longer available or have been removed. Plus, they seem not to keep things in stock anymore.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Anganika. We're incredibly sorry to hear that your experience with us has declined, and we want to make this right. Could you please send us an email at reviews@gopuff.com with more details along with a link or screenshot to this review so we can look into these issues further? - AN

scraped_reviews.content: Was really excited about this app. Had the 1st time credit and ordered. They called me and said they no longer had an item, no big deal. Asked them if I was able to change payment to card, they told me I had to cancel the order on the app and reorder. I said I'll look into it. I did and no cancel button available after they start the order, so I found the payment in cash and waited. I found out they cancelled it on their end, so I tried to reorder and my credit would not work. Disappointed.

Made an order like usual. It said I could add more to the same order with a certain amount of time. I ended up adding one more item and it prompted me through the purchase but made it a separate transaction without letting me know before hand. When I found out and asked customer service for help they blew me off and told me I messed up even though I followed their prompt. I'll never use them again. Terrible customer service.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: This is unacceptable and we're very sorry about this. Please allow us to look into your situation! Send us an email us the details at reviews@gopuff.com so we can get to work! - Nikki

scraped_reviews.content: I learned of GoPuff a couple weeks ago, and downloaded the app. Living in Chicago, convenience is pretty nice. I ordered to my apartment 4 times, without issue, with friendly drivers! Yesterday, I opened the app and lo and behold my apartment is no longer in the delivery area, somehow. This shouldn't happen, and is truly disappointing. Hopefully you sort yourselves out soon.

EDIT: still a great app, but since they did away with the points, i went from ordering 2 - 3 times a week to... once since they got rid of it. Bad move imo. I guess I just dont have a reason to open the app everyday anymore or use my deals - - - - The best app for delivery. They always show up within the hour, they never mess up the orders, and if they're out of something they call you immediately
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Domino! Thank you so much for your review and feedback. We are pleased to hear your experience with our service has been great. If you have any questions or feedback on how we can improve, please contact us at reviews@gopuff.com. We would love to hear from you! - AN

scraped_reviews.content: I use the app all the time and love the service. My problem is with the app itself. Since October of 2019, every time i place an order, the next screen says "an error has occured. Please try again later". My order still goes through i still get my order delivered to me. My issue is that i cant view the order in the app and have to rely on the text updates to track my order which isnt the worst thing in the world but it would be nice to not have a constant error message after placing an order

The app is utter garbage. Constant connection issues on wifi AND mobile, every item I tried adding to my cart didn't add or were available, when I went to place my order it said I was $5 away from the order minimum. So I added $8 more worth of product. It let me check out, then when I went to check out, it said it again and THEN removed every item. First time trying this app out and last time. I didn't even get an order.

Used gopuff for almost a year and I'm done. They ALWAYS miss 1 item from orders. Sometimes it's 2. And they don't tell you til the delivery person gets to your door. They only call ahead if it's the entire order - which has sadly happened several times. You don't even get refunded. They'll only give you gopuff credit, so you have to place another gd order! "We deliver fast" is a flat out lie, you're lucky to get an order in under an hour. You're better off ordering appetizers from another app.

Well I used them for a while and it was great! Loved the convenience and options. Then it started to go downhill about 2 months ago. So many items I'd usually order always out of stock, then if I was lucky to get them delivery times were VERY long. Now today was the cherry on top. They no longer deliver to either of my addresses. I guess all my points will go to waste since I can't use them. I'll update this review if they ever start delivering to me again, but for now, don't waste your time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We are so sorry about this situation, Jesse. Please let us look into this by messaging us at reviews@gopuff.com and send us your zip code so we can forward it to our team in hopes of expanding to your area. - JB

scraped_reviews.content: We consistently have a horrible experience ordering on the app. The estimated delivery time is never accurate and we're always waiting hours for our stuff. And when it finally comes, they usually forgot something or threw in some random other thing we didn't order. One time we called support to check on an order that was taking forever, and they straight up cancelled it without even asking first. The rewards points are also worthless, there's nothing good to redeem them for. Would not recommend.

They charged me twice then immediately canceled due to "payment iisues." So now I'll have to wait several days for the money to appear back in my checking account. Customer service couldn't provide an explanation, but insisted they would call back when they determined what happened. They never called back. Terrible app. Terrible customer service. Never again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We'll look into this issue for you. Please send us a note at reviews@gopuff.com so that we can follow up.

scraped_reviews.content: If I could give them 0 stars I would. This is by far the worst food delivery app I've ever encountered. I downloaded the app last night, made an account and received a $20 off coupon for my first order that I was excited to use. After I built up my cart and tried to checkout, they flagged my account for unusual activity and closed my account and blocked me from ever being able to make a new one and they won't even tell me why. Ridiculous and awful service.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Harley. We're incredibly sorry for any frustration and would be happy to assist you further. Could you please send an email to us at reviews@gopuff.com with the account details? - AN

scraped_reviews.content: Terrible experience, customer service was never helpful besides when I finally asked them to delete my account. Some of the promotions are just lies, you'll get nothing like many other customers have reported. They'll give you the run around and continuously transfer you to other agents until you give up. They need to re-evaluate their business practices, they've probably already lost so many customers due to this. So annoyed after spending hundreds on purchases. I'm just done trying with them.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: This doesn't seem right. We want to take a closer look at this for you. Please send a note to reviews@gopuff.com so we can connect.

scraped_reviews.content: The app continually crashes. On top of that, the service provided by this company is terrible. I used this service for many an order, and within the last six or seven months, everything has gone downhill. Pieces of the order we're missing, or the bags stunk like smoke, or items were swapped out without any notification. I would get a notice that my order was on its way an hour after I received the order. Or I would just get no notifications that the order was there. A bad company overall.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Joe. We're incredibly sorry to hear that your experience with us has declined, and we want to make this right. Could you please send us an email at reviews@gopuff.com with more details along with a link or screenshot to this review so we can look into these issues further? - AN

scraped_reviews.content: User experience of this app and service has been on a steady decline for a while now. App is barely useable half the time. Doesn't matter if it's on a new $1500 phone or two others. Significant other has the other brand of phone and it's a mess on there too. Every experience is worse than the last. Missing items, "help/chat" don't even work. I've wasted 4 of the last 24 hours just trying to connect to support on 3 different devices. Use to be my goto app, but not so much now, feels scammy.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Anthony. We're incredibly sorry to hear that your experience with us has declined, and we want to make this right. Could you please send us an email at reviews@gopuff.com with more details along with a link or screenshot to this review so we can look into these issues further? - AN

scraped_reviews.content: As a lot of reviews have described, this is a waste of time, literally. Every ad I had seen promoted speedy delivery. After placing my first order, my delivery window was from 1hr 10 min - 1hr 40 min away from the time of order. 2.5 hours later, still no sign of the driver. Seems like a scam. Gave the 2nd star because I was able to get through to customer service quickly and have the order canceled & refunded immediately.

I am a regular user for 2 years. Item pricing has gotten out of hand. With people needing to stay home deliveries increasing but some of these are ridiculous and almost price gouging! $3 for a single roll of toilet paper when they have always been .99? Besides that they don't even deliver most of the "smoke shop" items anymore and a lot of my fav items are gone. Barley even have wine at my location anymore. It has turned into over priced grocery snack delivery ‚òπÔ∏è

I placed an order for 5 items. While I was watching the progress screen my order changed from 5 to 3 items. I called support and she said she could cancel the order and I could place it again, and I asked if the same thing would just happen the next time. She refused to answer my question, just repeated the same thing about canceling and resubmitting the order 3 times. Was I even talking to a real person?? I just said I'd take the 3 items and hung up. Next time I'll just use instacart.

Already loving GoPuff! Used it for the first time ever recently and my somewhat big order arrived in about 30 minutes. My entire order was correct. None of the frozen items were even close to melting. Nothing beats this after a long day at work and not wanting to stop anywhere! Delivery fee was $2, no problem for me. Items are tad overpriced but not bad at all. Well worth the small mark up, in my opinion. Awesome! Will be trying again.

It was a great service up until recently. Orders have been taking over an hour to be delivered. One of my orders was marked delivered but I never got it and they never refunded me the 12,000 puff points I used on a reward for that order. I'm past 50 minutes of waiting now, when they said it would be 15-25 minutes when I ordered. At this point, I might as well use Instacart for a wider variety and similar delivery time. Gorillas consistently delivers within 20 minutes, at least
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there, Rebecca. We apologize for the delayed delivery, as our goal is for your order to get to you as quickly as possible. Can you please send us the details of this situation to reviews@gopuff.com and a screenshot or link to this review so we can make this right? - JB

scraped_reviews.content: My order was quickly delivered, (instacart takes at least an hour, I got my order in less than 10 mins,) there was no hassle in getting set up whatsoever, and on top of all of that there was some freebies with my delivery to introduce me to goPuff. Talk about customer service! My delivery driver was very nice, and I was 100% happy and satisfied. Would recommend to friends, and will definitely be using again.

The ETA is never correct. I waited for an order for over an hour, which included frozen and cold items. The fact I couldn't cancel and was forced to just sit and wait is ridiculous. The fact that you have no support that I could get into contact with because "well, it's only been about an hour" is ridiculous. I haven't used this app for months, and now I remember why I stopped. If you don't have the drivers, say so, and don't waste customer time pretending to be convenient.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Makayla. We're incredibly sorry for any inconvenience and want to make this right as soon as possible. Could you please send us an email at accountstatus@gopuff.com with the details and a link or screenshot to this review? We will be right there to assist you. - AN

scraped_reviews.content: I've been a customer for years, however my last few orders have stated delivery time of 25-30mins and taken OVER 1-2hrs late at night, ridiculous. When I attempted to contact customer support the agent, they were rude and very little to no help. I get delays happen, if reasonable, however I find it hard to support a company that cannot offer reliable delivery of items to customers. Half the time items aren't available, or the app doesnt work at all. I'm very disappointed and frustrated.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey, Siobhan. We're truly sorry for the experience you've had with us and understand how frustrating this must have been. This is not the service we strive to provide, and we want to make this right asap. Could you please send your order details to us at reviews@gopuff.com along with a link or screenshot to this review? - AN

title: Webull: Investing & Trading
description:
Webull offers all the investing products you need - stocks, ETFs, options, futures, bonds, cash equivalents, and more. Join and earn a 2% match bonus on your deposits!

INVEST & MANAGE YOUR WEALTH
- Earn an extra 2% by funding your account
- Unlock 3.6% APY cash management and up to 3.5% IRA match through Webull Premium (subscription required)
- Power your growth with treasuries, bonds, Webull Smart Advisor, recurring investments, and more

TRADE WHAT YOU WANT
- Enjoy $0 commissions on stocks, ETFs, and options, plus lower margin rates
- Predict and trade on sports events, index trends, crypto price changes, and Fed events
- Leverage options and futures strategies with low costs: $0 contract fees for equity options, just $0.5 for index options*, and futures contracts starting from $0.25
- Buy & sell Crypto on the Webull app. Safe. Secure. Trusted.

SMART TOOLS FOR CONFIDENT TRADING
- Vega AI brings together market data, portfolio trends, and real-time signals to help you understand what‚Äôs moving the markets
- Access advanced charts, over 60 technical indicators, and 17+ professional tools for in-depth analysis
- Practice risk-free with Paper Trading and trade overnight - from Sunday 8:00 PM ET to Friday 8:00 PM ET

DISCLOSURES
Webull Financial LLC (member SIPC, FINRA) offers self-directed securities trading. All investments involve risk. Index Option Contract Fees, Regulatory Fees, Exchange Fees and other Fees may apply. More info: https://www.webull.com/policy

Options are not suitable for everyone. Losses can occur quickly. Review ODD at https://www.webull.com/policy. *Certain Index Options and Oversize Option orders will incur a per-contract fee. 

Advisory services are offered through Webull Advisors LLC, an SEC-registered investment adviser. Registration does not imply a certain level of skill or training. Investing involves risk, including possible loss of principal. Past performance is not indicative of future results. For more details, review our Form ADV at Webull - Policy under Webull Advisors.

Cryptocurrency trading is offered by Webull Pay LLC (NMLS ID 1886762). Webull Financial LLC and Webull Pay LLC are separate entities. All investments in crypto assets involve substantial risk and are not suitable for all investors. Cryptocurrency is not a security and is not FDIC or SIPC insured. 

Please note futures trading involves substantial risk and is not suitable for all investors. Please read the FCM Risk Disclosure statement (https://www.webull.com/fcm-disclosures) prior to signing up for Futures Trading

Address: 44 Wall Street, Ste 501, New York, NY 10005, United States.
Email: support@webull.com

Subscription Descriptions
1. Privacy Policy: www.webull.com/PrivacyPolicy.html
2. Service Agreement: www.webull.com/ServiceAgreement.html
